text:
you're watching video vocab by business 
English pod dot-com in this lesson we'll

look at vocabulary related to manufacturing 
companies manufactured goods in plants or

factories where they put together raw materials 
or various parts and components into a final

product will cover ideas such as fabrication 
as well as the assembly line where goods are

assembled manufacturers rely on quality control or 
QC to ensure the quality of their finished goods

manufacture manufacturing 
manufacturing is the process

of making goods or products 
especially on a large scale

manufactured goods range from simple pencils 
to advanced airplanes Canada sells wood to

China where it is used to manufacture 
furniture for the North American market
plant Factory

Manufacturing normally takes place in 
large buildings called plants or factories

in a plant goods are created through a 
combination of machines and human labour

Jaguar Land Rovers new plant in Slovakia 
the company's third overseas Factory will

employ almost 3,000 workers raw materials raw 
materials raw materials are the basic materials

used in the manufacturing process this includes 
natural resources such as oil wood and metals
because South Korea lacks natural resources its

economy relies on raw materials 
imported from other countries

components parts manufactured products may 
be built from smaller components or parts

some products are actually made up 
of thousands of tiny components made

via the companies the iPhone is built 
from components made by several other

companies including Samsung Broadcom 
and ST micro fabrication fabrication

generally fabrication is the making of 
a product by combining different parts

fabrication can also refer to the manufacturer 
of products made exclusively from metal such

as car bodies or steel frames 
construction of a new warehouse

started with the fabrication of a 
steel framework for the building
assemble assembly line

assembling means putting together various 
parts in the manufacturing process
assembly is usually done in an organized sequence

of workstations called an assembly line 
most Boeing airlines are assembled in

the Seattle area from parts that are made in 
countries all over the world quality control

QC to ensure consistency in manufacturing 
companies use quality control or QC

this involves inspecting products 
for problems or testing them to

make sure they work correctly before 
being sold every one of our machines

passes through our QC division where it is 
inspected for flaws or defects finish goods

finished goods the final results of the 
manufacturing process our finished goods

finish goods of passed inspection and are 
ready to be distributed to customers our

manufacturing process transforms raw materials 
into finished goods in a matter of hours

now it's your turn to practice some of the words 
we've looked at in this lesson in a moment you'll

hear a series of sentences with a word replaced 
with a beep repeat each sentence including the

missing word for example if you hear we carefully 
inspect all finished before shipping them to

retailers you can say we carefully inspect all 
finished goods before shipping them to retailers

we'll provide the recked answer after 
each question ready let's give it a go

it is cheaper to buy the to make our products 
than manufacture those parts ourselves answer

it is cheaper to buy the components to make our 
products than manufacture those parts ourselves

Manufacturing costs have gone down since 
the price of raw light copper have dropped
answer manufacturing costs have gone down since

the price of raw materials 
like copper have dropped
you

a minor electrical problem forced the 
Assembly to shut down for a few hours

answer a minor electrical problem forced the 
assembly line to shut down for a few hours

that's all for this episode of video 
vocab be sure to check out our website

at www.att.com/biz nough Singlish vocabulary 
thanks for watching and see you again soon
